title: Sauropod
description:
A sauropod, a massive, plant-eating dinosaur with a long neck and tail. Depicted as a blue, gray, or green sauropod, as a brachiosaurus, apatosaurus/brontosaurus, or diplodocus. Shown in full profile on all fours facing left.

May be used to represent various dinosaurs. See also ðŸ¦– T-Rex.

May also be used to call a person a dinosaur, i.e. imply that they are old-fashioned or out-of-touch with modern sentiments.

Apple, Google and Samsung's sauropods resemble a brachiosaurus. Samsung’s sauropod was previously green, Facebook’s previously displayed only a green head.
apple_vendor_description: The sauropod emoji on Apple devices is a majestic depiction of a long-necked dinosaur, its immense form rendered with detailed scales and a powerful silhouette. Appleâ€™s glossy 3D shading and realistic lighting give the creature a sense of ancient grandeur and palpable presence, while its smooth, rounded contours suggest its gentle, herbivorous nature. This prehistoric giant, brought to life on Apple devices, evokes a sense of awe, history, and the vastness of time.
